title: Business Live: Berkeley shares tumble - BBC News
summary: influential mp calls for scrutiny of gkn bid .
wetherspoon 'cautious ' about outlook for this year .
goldman sachs reveals 55.5 % mean average pay gap .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for this week on business live .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 on monday .
do join us then for all the latest breaking news and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: wall street closes slightly ahead
text: the dow jones industrial average has closed slightly higher , rising 72.9 points to 24,946.51 , thanks to strong industrial output numbers .
the s & p 500 gained 4.7 points to 2,752.01 .
the tech-heavy nasdaq ended flat - up just 0.25 points to 7,481.99 .

documents.title: coca-cola using blockchain to fight forced labour
text: coca-cola is teaming up with the us state department and several blockchain companies to help combat the use of forced labour worldwide .
according to the international labor organization , nearly 25 million people work in forced-labor conditions worldwide , with 47 % of them in the asia-pacific region .
food and beverage companies are under pressure to fight the risk of forced labour in countries where they obtain sugarcane .

we are partnering with the pilot of this project to further increase transparency and efficiency of the verification process related to labor policies within our supply chain , '' brent wilton , the company 's global head of workplace rights , told reuters .

documents.title: nike investigating workplace conduct
text: nike is investigating its workplace conduct and two senior executives have left the sportswear giant .
jayme martin , vice-president and manager of global categories , has left the corporation , as well as trevor edwards , who was originally due to retire in august , according to the ft .
mr edwards was considered to be a potential successor to chief executive mark parker .
a nike spokesperson said : there has been conduct inconsistent with nike 's principles and we are taking the appropriate actions '' .

documents.title: trump negotiating over trade tariffs
text: us president donald trump is currently negotiating with a number of countries over the possibility of exemptions to new tariffs on steel and aluminum imports .

`` he 's working with a number of individual countries and negotiating on areas of national security where we can work together and there 's some flexibility there , '' white house spokeswoman sarah sanders told reporters .
`` we 're continuing to have those conversation and will continue through the end of next week . ''

documents.title: hundreds of nurses 'hit by student loan errors '
text: hundreds of nursing students at nine universities have been hit with errors in their student loan payments , the royal college of nursing says .
the students have been told they were mistakenly overpaid between £ 600 and £ 5,000 by the student loans company and to expect no more payments this year .
the letters came months after money was received and is leaving some students struggling to pay bills and rent .
the student loans company said it was aware of the issues .

documents.title: virtual cash helps cyber-thieves launder money , research suggests
text: crypto-currencies and digital cash systems have become a key way for cyber-thieves to launder stolen funds , suggests research .
alongside its use in ransomware , virtual cash was also helping clean up other sources of stolen cash , said criminologist dr mike maguire .
bitcoin 's anonymity made it attractive to tech-savvy thieves , he said .
dr mcguire drew on interviews with cyber-thieves , police reports and dark web searches for the study .

documents.title: camelot warns of 'low level ' national lottery hack
text: national lottery owner camelot has warned of a low-level cyberattack that affected 150 customer accounts .
it has asked all of its customers to change the passwords on their accounts as a precaution .
the hackers used credentials gleaned from a list circulated on the internet to get into the accounts , a camelot spokeswoman said .
no money was stolen , and the attackers saw limited information , the spokeswoman added .

documents.title: london wheelchair travellers get google maps help
text: wheelchair users travelling in london and other worldwide cities on public transport can now get accessibility information from google maps .
users will be able to filter for `` wheelchair accessible '' advice when planning journeys in the capital .
however disability groups warned the information needs to be up-to-date and accurate in order to be helpful .
the service is initially available on desktop and will be rolling out across iphone and android devices .

documents.title: apple founder 's job application sells for $ 174,000 at auction
text: a one-page job application that steve jobs filled out in 1973 , before he went on to found apple , has sold at auction for $ 174 , 575 .
according to us auction house rr auction , the winner was a british internet entrepreneur .

there are many collectors who have earned disposable income over the last few decades using apple technology , and we expect similarly strong results on related material in the future , '' bobby livingston , executive vice president at rr auction , said in a statement .

documents.title: what the distant past told us about the future of work
text: all the times we 've predicted - wrongly - how technology will save our lives .
click here to see a fun infographic from bbc capital .

documents.title: topman withdraws shirt amid hillsborough anger
text: retailer topman has withdrawn a shirt after criticism it could be seen referring to the hillsborough disaster .
the red shirt with a large number 96 is being seen by some liverpool fans as a reference to the club 's kit and number of victims killed in the 1989 disaster .
louise brookes , whose brother andrew died in the tragedy , and mp for wirral south alison mcgovern were among those calling for it to be removed from sale .

documents.title: pm accused of plan to open borders
text: pm accused of plan to open borders

documents.title: hassle on the horizon
text: further to the news that the cost of new travel policies could soon rise if the principles of a brexit deal are n't hammered out next week , insurers are now very concerned .
huw evans , the director general of the association of british insurers , said : `` it 's very important that the government reaches agreement next week with our european partners . ''
`` travellers and motorists could easily be disrupted if we do n't have an agreement for what happens when we leave the eu in march 2019 , '' he said .
the government appears optimistic that the situation wo n't arise .
the department for exiting the eu said it was increasingly confident about a deal with the eu and that the prospect of leaving without one had reduced significantly .

documents.title: 'timing is everything '
text: in mauritius almost 90 % of cultivated land is dedicated to sugarcane farming .
however , some farmers have also started investing in the more exclusive , luxury crop of vanilla .
the bbc 's lerato mbele went to see how vanilla is farmed and spoke to specialist charlotte daguenet about the challenges of producing the perfect pod .

documents.title: travel insurance could rise if there is no brexit agreement
text: it 's only two weeks until the annual policies insurers sell will need to provide cover beyond brexit day , the 29th march next year .
if there 's a transition period , perhaps to the end of 2020 , the process is expected to carry on as before .
but if there 's no agreement next week , insurers say they will have to fear the worst .
they could start warning motor policyholders that they will need a green card - an international document proving you have insurance - when they drive their cars into the eu after brexit .
and if travellers ca n't depend on their ehic cards , which entitle them to medical treatment across the eu , the price of travel insurance will be affected .
if you 're a motorist it would mean that you need to have green card documentation to carry with you and to show at a border crossing if required .

and if you are a holidaymaker it means that you will have a to buy a travel insurance policy that covers you for things that are currently covered by the ehic card , which will probably cost you more .
author: Simon Gompertz
BBC personal finance correspondent

documents.title: london closes slightly ahead
text: london shares have closed slightly ahead , thanks to gains in energy and financial stocks .
the ftse 100 gained 24.4 points or 0.3 % to 7,164.14 , led by easyjet , which rose 2 % to £ 16.58 .
however , the index still registered a weekly loss of 0.7 % .
meanwhile the ftse 250 dipped 23.5 points or 0.1 % to 19,804.90 .
the losers were led by wetherspoon , which fell 6.3 % to £ 12.14 after announcing that future trading would be tough , despite the fact its half-year sales and profits were up .

documents.title: professional shopping , overseas
text: with the increasing distrust in domestic products in china , a new business opportunity has arisen - chinese expats who buy consumer goods for people back home in china .
connecting with buyers via chinese social messaging app wechat , sandra lee purchases items from australian supermarkets and other retailers on their behalf , and then posts them to china .
an overseas personal shopper , she is known in china as a `` daigou '' , and ms lee is far from alone .
more than a million people globally are now working as daigou , according to some estimates .

documents.title: 'they were just using us as free labour '
text: mps and lawyers are calling on the uk government to ban companies from offering unpaid shifts as the means to getting a possible job .
maxine says that an unpaid trial shift left her stranded without any money .
her experience is n't unique - unpaid shifts are common and often there is no guarantee of a job at the end of it .
some mps and lawyers are calling for a blanket ban .
companies can currently offer trial shifts - but there has been an increase over three years in complaints over shifts , unite said .
the fsb said unpaid shifts are a valuable part of the recruitment process , but should n't cross the line into exploitation .
@ twitterid how many of these have you done in bar work ?
a fair few but us hospitality folk with @ twitterid are gon na try and change it
@ twitterid and the bbc does n't use free interns how many people have been asked to work for no pay '' at the bbc

documents.title: are 'cryonic technicians ' the key to immortality ?
text: are you open minded about the future ?
do you have a medical background and can you complete tasks under time pressure ?
are you comfortable working in the presence of a dead body ?
this is not the job description for a victorian grave snatcher .
instead , it 's the ideal attributes of a cryonics technician ; someone who preserves the bodies of the recently deceased in the hope they will one day be revived .
read more here .

documents.title: watch : how uncertainty helps this drone fly
text: a drone which uses models of uncertainty to help it fly has been developed by the massachusetts institute of technology 's computer science and artificial intelligence laboratory ( csail ) .
the nanomap system uses depth-sensing technology to measure the environment around it and allows the drone to avoid hitting objects while flying at speeds of 20mph ( 32km/h ) .

documents.title: 'effecting change takes time '
text: lloyd blankfein , the chief executive of goldman sachs , has sent his employees a memo outlining how the finance giant intends to tackle its gender pay gap problem .
`` effecting change requires time , the collective focus of our people , and new thinking to drive incremental , but meaningful , progress for our firm , '' he said .
`` we are committed to having women represent 50 % of our global talent over time .
an important first step is to have women make up 50 % of our incoming analyst class - and we are working to achieve this goal by 2021 . ''

he said that goldman sachs needs to hold itself accountable for providing more opportunities for women and ensuring that its workforce is `` more diverse '' and represents the communities where its employees live and work .

documents.title: wall street slightly ahead
text: wall street shares are slightly ahead , thanks to gains in technology and financial stocks .

the dow jones has risen 78.8 points or 0.3 % to 24,947.53 , led by home depot , rising 1.2 % to $ 180.22 on the news that is hiring 700 workers in colorado , and that it has committed $ 6.3m to reviving atlanta 's westside communities .
the s & p 500 has climbed 12.4 points or 0.45 % to 2,7560 .

the top of the winners is spectra energy , up 2.5 % to $ 11.43 after announcing it will not be negatively affected by a us federal regulator decision to stop master-limited partnership gas distribution companies from receiving credits on income taxes they are n't paying .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is up 24 points or 0.3 % to 7,505.75 , led by biotechnology firmorigin agritech , climbing 22.8 % to $ 1.23 after appointing a new chief executive .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks ben and dearbail for this morning 's live coverage of all things business .
mary-ann russon with you until 21:30 for the rest of the day 's news and views .
fun fact of the day - today is the 80th anniversary of the hms belfast .
a six-gun salute was fired earlier to mark the occasion .
got a point of view ?
tweet me at @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: biohacker fined for travel card implant
text: a biohacker in australia has been fined a $ 220 ( £ 120 , $ 170 ) for removing the chip from a travel card and implanting it into his hand .
meow-ludo disco gamma meow-meow ( real name ) also has to pay a $ 1,000 in costs .
the case was brought by the new south wales transport authority which issues the contactless opal card .
mr meow-meow was charged for travelling without a ticket , although the fare was on the chip inside his hand .
read the full story here .

documents.title: goldmans gender pay gap in context
text: here 's how goldman sachs compares with the others in its sector that have reported so far .
as you can see , it is well up with thojse with the biggest gap .

documents.title: goldman pledges more senior women
text: along with its figures , the firm says this : `` we are a meritocracy , and gender is not a factor in the way that we pay our people .
we pay women and men in the same way , using the same compensation criteria , including the nature of their role and their performance .
`` the fundamental challenge we should all be focused on is increasing the representation of women at senior levels .
this is where the real imbalance lies , and requires attention at the earliest stages of recruitment to attract more women to financial services roles . ''
it has a plan to increase the number of women in senior roles to 30 % of senior talent ( vice president and above ) by 2023 .

documents.title: goldman gender pay gap
text: goldman sachs points out it employs more men in senior positions than it does women , as the table it has just published shows .

documents.title: goldman gender pay gap - more detail
text: goldman gender pay gap - more detail

documents.title: goldman sachs reveals gender pay gap
text: international finance giant goldman sachs has revealed its gender pay gap .
the median ( the measure the bbc has been using ) hourly gap is 36.4 % and the mean is 55.5 % .
that is for the firm worldwide .

documents.title: the draw of scotland
text: why are tourists flocking to scotland ?

documents.title: us stock markets open up
text: the dow jones industrial average opened up 26.05 points or 0.10 % at 24,899.71
the s & p 500 is ahead 7.79 points in opening trade at 2,755.12
the nasdaq is up 18.61 points at 7,500.35 .

documents.title: europe no good for tech
text: `` there are no successful tech companies in europe , `` according to paypal co-founder and investor peter thiel and reported in the guardian .

speaking at the economic club of new york , mr thiel said that european regulator are clamping down on silicon valley companies because they are `` jealous '' of how successful us tech firms have become .
peter thiel is an adviser to donald trump , you can find out more about him here .

documents.title: challenges ahead for tiffany
text: luxury jeweller tiffany & co reported a strong finish to an otherwise challenging financial year .
like-for-like sales for the three months to 31 january rose by 3 % and total revenue grew by 9 % to $ 1.3bn .
underlying net profit increased by 15 % to $ 208m .
however , for profit for the full-year fell 17 % to $ 370m on flat like-for-like sales growth .
tiffany chief executive alessandro bogliolo said : `` we are pleased to be finishing the year with solid sales growth , both geographically and across product categories .
most important , however , is to generate sustainable growth in sales , margins and earnings over the long-term . ''

the company said it will increase investment in a number of areas such as technology , marketing and store presentation which it expects to `` hinder pre-tax earnings growth in the near-term '' but will `` generate that lasting long-term growth '' .

documents.title: cobalt deal lifts glencore shares
text: the ftse 100 is just about hanging onto gains at midday .
the blue chip index is trading up 0.17 % at 7,151 .

commodities trader and miner glencore is now leading the ftse 100 , with its share price up `` % at 386.7p following a three-year deal to sell a third of its cobalt production to chinese company gem ,
berkeley group , the house builder , continues to lead the fallers with its stock down 3.9 % at £ 37.67 after it said it would not build more homes because of economic uncertainty .
the ftse 250 is down 0.47 % at 19,735.27 .
shares in nex soared by nearly 30 % to 869p .
the electronic trading group has received a takeover approach from future 's exchange cme .

documents.title: investors charge out of the bunker
text: you might remember that last month the markets went a bit haywire , sparked by a strong report on us wages which raised fears of a surge in inflation .
in one week the dow jones industrial average saw two one-day falls of more than 1,000 points , which is pretty whacky .
well investors appear to have recovered from that panic attack .
the financial times reports that globally investors sank $ 43bn into stock funds and etfs in the past week - a record .
( an etf is an investment product traded on stock markets that can track all sorts of assets . )
the ft quotes figures from investment bank jefferies .

documents.title: friends in the white house ?
text: for readers of a certain vintage
i keep misreading larry kudlow for lisa kudrow and i keep phoebe in the white house and my brain ca n't handle the dissonance .

documents.title: wetherspoon eating up the high street
text: analysts at peel hunt say the pub chain jd wetherspoon is taking market share from restaurants .
its investment in breakfast options , beer gardens , accommodation , plus an app which favours food are paying off , they say .
the report notes that jd wetherspoon like-for-like food sales were up 6.9 % in the first half of the year .
that contrasts with the grim recent history for chain restaurants in the uk .
prezzo , jamie 's italian and byron have all been forced to close outlets .

documents.title: how to wind up an economics phd
text: larry kudlow has been appointed the top economic advisor to donald trump .
there has been some debate on social media over his credentials , given that he does not have a phd in economics .
but chris dillow has this little wind-up for economists with phds .
given that the opportunity cost of a phd in economics is huge ( 3 years of foregone good earnings ) one would expect many ( potentially ? )
good economists not to have one .
only if they only perceive value in £ - perfectly possible they value e.g satisfaction , satiation of curiosity etc .
does n't imply irrationality , just different measures .
i was n't making any assumption re rationality .
true , a phd has non-pecuniary satisfactions .
but also , one can study the economy from a central bank , investment bank or treasury too
yeah , but you have to get up early every morning then , and they do n't have £ 1 a pint in the bar .
are n't you assuming there were opportunities ?
yes .
back in the 80s/90s when finance was expanding there were tons .
things would have been different for someone graduating post-crisis .
oh yeah .
i was just making joke .
only if the assumption that people are rational holds , and biology is a challenge to that idea ?

puts systems thinking hat on the biological roots of both individual and organisational cognition are inescapable and rationality in complex situations necessarily depends on potentially differing subjective experiences [ galaxy-post-it.jpg ]
ah yes , but it 's your balls that are rational , not your brain
that combined with europeans being moderately drunk morning to night from babylon to about 1918 really helps explain a lot
it 's not the lower income whilst you 're doing it , it 's the lower income ever after .
if £ is your objective , very few big £ careers want a phd .

economists understand that they ( being human ) are not always rational , but if maximising their own income was a priority objective they probably would n't be professional economists in the first place .
this is true .
everyone in my economics department thought in terms of opportunity cost .
those solely trying to maximize earnings probably do n't go into economics in the first place
given some of the economics that is taught/researched at postgrad level i think it not having one is probably an advantage .
especially when much ( if not most ) of the content is not important towards understanding how the economy operates .
personally there is something depressing about studying a system where you are quite far down the pecking order of said system .
i 'd rather study something like physics where part of the appeal is the escapism from everyday human existance .
what if you are a left wing economist ?
i 'm sure marxist economists are in it for some kind of anti-capital actavism as apposed to maximising thier own earnings .

documents.title: l'oreal buys beauty try-on tech group
text: french cosmetics giant l'oreal has bought a company that specialises in technology which provides beauty try-on simulations on live video .
modiface is a canadian company which has `` developed advanced technologies of 3d virtual make-up , color and skin diagnosis services '' which `` track facial features and color '' .

lubomira rochet , chief digital officer of l'oreal , says : `` modiface will support the reinvention of the beauty experience around innovative services to help our customers discover , try and chose products and brands . ''

documents.title: carillion collapse 'raises fundamental questions '
text: mitie says that the collapse of carillion raises `` some fundamental questions about the outsourcing industry '' .
in a trading update , the outsourcing company 's chief executive phil bentley , said : `` managing the buildings and the workplaces of our clients is a complex business . ''
mitie is undergoing a turnaround programme and it said sales growth for the year to 31 march was `` modest '' .
it was recently relegated from the ftse 250 in the latest quarterly review on the stock market indexes
but mitie said operating profits were in line with expectations and its debt is `` comfortably within banking covenants . ''
mr bentley said : `` the year ahead will remain challenging as we continue to transform mitie , but we expect to see modest revenue growth with improved profits and cash flow generation . ''

documents.title: testing for financial armageddon
text: the bank of england says it will use the following criteria to see how financial firms would perform under pressure :
if banks fail the test , it may mean they have to raise more money to build up their capital buffers which help them withstand seismic events .
in 2017 , all banks who were tested passed without having to take any action , though barclays and the royal bank of scotland were the weakest performers in the event of a severe downturn .

documents.title: markets : ftse 100 moves higher ; berkeley down
text: the ftse 100 has pushed into positive territory .
it 's nothing spectacular - a gain of 13 points to 7,152 .
easyjet is the biggest winner , up 1.4 % .
berkeley is still the biggest loser with a 5 % fall .
berkeley 's results highlight the development of something of a mexican stand-off between housebuilders and the government , '' said george salmon , equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown .
`` theresa may is saying builders need to open up their land banks and develop more sites , while berkeley is unwilling to aggressively ramp up production .
`` with conditions in the capital starting to look more precarious , it 's easy to see why berkeley has reservations .
after all , adopting overly ambitious strategies just before the market turns has caught out many a builder over the years , '' he said .

documents.title: porsche pushes electric
text: sportscar maker porsche is doubling its spending on future projects , including committing 6bn euros towards electric cars and infrastructure by 2022 .
the money will be spent on developing spin-offs from its mission e ( electrifying the current range and developing charging infrastructure .
in 2017 the company set records for deliveries , sales and operating profits .

documents.title: bank to use 2017 measures to stress-test banks
text: the bank of england has announced that it will use the same criteria as 2017 to stress test the uk 's banks .
the tests , introduced following the financial crisis , are used to see if a bank can withstand seismic events .

in an announcement , the bank of england said : `` the 2018 annual cyclical scenario tests the resilience of the uk banking system to deep simultaneous recessions in the uk and global economies , large falls in asset prices and a separate stress of misconduct costs . ''

documents.title: not quite ready to let go
text: although li ka-shing is retiring as chairman of ck hutchison holdings at the company 's annual general meeting on 10 may , he will stay on as senior adviser .
his eldest son , victor li , who was named successor several years ago , will take over running the business .

documents.title: sterling rises on weaker dollar
text: the pound ticked higher on a weaker dollar this morning , up 0.19 % at $ 1.39650 .
the dollar has lost ground following a report in the washington post that us president donald trump is set to replace his national security adviser lieutenant general hr mcmaster .
it would follow the departure of secretary of state rex tillerson , which emerged earlier this week , and the resignation of chief economic adviser gary cohn last week .

documents.title: li ka-shing to retire
text: li ka-shing , hong kong 's richest man , is retiring as chairman of ck hutchiston .
his departure at the age of 89 marks the end of a remarkable career .
mr li built the company from scratch to a giant in property , telecoms , shipping and retail .

documents.title: berkeley biggest ftse 100 loser
text: shares in berkeley group are the biggest losers on the ftse 100 .
shares are down 5 % after it said it would not be increasing the number of houses and flats it builds this year .
overall the ftse 100 is little changed at 7,135 .

documents.title: wetherspoon 'rare high street success story '
text: shares in jd wetherspoon are up 3 % this morning , after it reported a strong first half to its financial year .
richard hunter , head of markets at interactive investors has this comment :
`` wetherspoon has been a rare success story on the uk high street in recent years , as its finely priced and simple offering has captured the imagination of the cost-conscious consumer .
today 's figures show further proof of its growth in a strong first-half .
`` there are , however , some less palatable indicators , not least of which is a very guarded outlook from the company for the second half .

the potential for extra world cup income which provides a boost to many other retailers does not necessarily apply to wetherspoon , whilst it fully expects to be battling with higher costs over the period . ''

documents.title: say 'i do ' at wetherspoons
text: searching for a wedding venue ?
look no further than a jd wetherspoon 's pub where people can choose to tie the knot .
chairman tim martin admits he 's not too sure how this service evolved .

he says : `` it 's a bit like someone in huckleberry finn who was n't born they just growed ( sic ) so i found about it myself in the press and apparently we 've been inundated with requests for people who want to get married . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: sugar tax costs weatherspoons £ 3m
text: in jd weatherspoon 's interim results , the pub group said it expects higher costs in the second half of the financial year .
these include rising pay and , according to chairman tim martin : `` all sorts of taxes [ such as ] jamie oliver 's sugar tax which he got us to pay but could n't pay himself .
he says the sugar tax cost the company £ 3m .
`` so it 's an era of rising taxes for pub and restaurant companies which makes life more difficult as people are saying . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: glitter wears off for 'trendy ' restaurants
text: it has been a tough few months for casual dining on the high street , is pub group jd wetherspoon facing the same problems ?
tim martin , chairman of jd wetherspoon , says that while the company is `` technically '' facing the same pressures but `` we seem to be doing quite well '' .

he says : `` i think that a lot of trendy-type , restaurant-type companies have all opened up at around the same time in the last 10 years , pay huge rents and the glitter has worn off a bit and they 've suffered a backlash from customers .
`` in the more prosaic world of greggs or mcdonald 's or starbucks , i think things are going reasonably well . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: arguments for gkn deal are 'finely balanced '
text: chris ralph , chief investment officer at st james 's place , reckons the arguments for and against melrose 's hostile takeover of gkn are `` finely balanced '' .
`` certainly , this intervention by airbus is going be important and it is something that fund managers will have to consider because airbus is an important part of gkn 's business . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: gkn : the pension question
text: under gkn 's proposed $ 6.1bn sale of us automotive arm to dana , it would take on $ 1bn of gkn 's pension deficit .
but business select committee chair rachel reeves questions whether the pension scheme would be any better protected under a takeover by melrose .
`` the pensions regulator has asked melrose to refer themselves to the regulator before this takeover is voted on by shareholders , '' she says .
`` melrose have n't done that .
so i do n't think people saving for a pension , or who draw their pension from gkn , can have certainty about melrose 's intentions .
they refer to their past takeovers and how they 've addressed pension deficits there .
`` but they 're not going to the pensions regulator to clarify or to make offer undertakings that would be legally enforceable on pensions , on r & d and on jobs . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: electronics firms lead japanese shares lower
text: japan 's benchmark nikkiei 225 finished the day down 0.6 % to 21,676 points , dragged lower by some of the bigger firms on the index .
electronics giant tdk corp finished down 3 % , while robot maker fanuc corp finished lower by 1.6 % .
australia 's benchmark s & p/asx 200 index was a bright spot in the region , finishing up 0.5 % to 5949 points .
wesfarmers gave the index a boost , with shares in the retail-to-mining giant rising more than 6 % on news it was set to spin off its coles supermarket arm .
the national supermarket chain costs more to run than it earns .
south korea 's benchmark kospi index finished flat at 2,493 points .
in china , hong kong 's hang seng index was down 0.39 % in late afternoon trade , together with the shanghai composite , which was down 0.6 % .

documents.title: breakingjd wetherspoon 'cautious ' over this year
text: pub operator jd wetherspoon is `` cautious '' about the outlook for the rest of the year .
`` the company anticipates higher costs in the second half of the financial year , in areas including pay , taxes and utilities .

`` in view of these additional costs , and our expectation that growth in like-for-like sales will be lower in the next six months , the company remains cautious about the second half of the year , '' said tim martin , chairman of the company .
however , the company says it expects an `` unchanged trading outcome '' for the current financial year .
jd wetherspoon reported pre-tax profits of £ 54m for the half-year to 28 january - up 36 % on the same period in the previous year .
sales were up 3.6 % to £ 830m .

documents.title: new management needed for gkn ?
text: would n't gkn be better under melrose 's ownership , given that it issued a profit warning last year , it had problems in its us business and its new chief executive left before he even started his job ?

business , energy and industrial strategy committee chair rachel reeves , says : `` it is absolutely true there have been problems and challenges at gkn but , that said , it is not clear to me that the best future for the business is under ownership which has such a short-term horizon . ''
she says that when melrose appeared before the committee to give evidence about the bid , it was asked to give undertakings on what their commitments would be on r+d , on pensions and on jobs .
`` they were n't able to give that in the evidence session .
they then followed up with a letter but in that letter there was nothing that was legally enforceable . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: melrose-gkn bid needs 'close ' look
text: melrose 's hostile bid for gkn took an extraordinary turn on thursday when major customer airbus stepped in to say it would n't give business to the ftse 100 engineering group if the bid goes ahead .

rachel reeves , chair of the business , energy and industrial strategy committee , agrees with the rationale behind airbus 's statement , and tells the today programme : `` i think there is a strong case for the secretary of state for business greg clark for calling in this takeover on grounds of national security because gkn does supply companies like airbus and others , rolls-royce for example , who have defence contracts .
`` there are grounds for looking at this much more closely . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: how can the city attract more female workers ?
text: hsbc has reported a 29 % median gender pay gap for its uk banking operations .
brenda trenowden is head of financial institutions at anz bank and also global chair of the 30 % club which campaigns to get more women into senior management .
she says the problem is that there are many fewer women in senior leadership roles than men .
work needs to be done to build a pipeline of women coming through .
however , there 's a perception that financial services is not an attractive sector for women .
her organisation surveryed 20,000 university students and found that financial services was the fourth choice of career for men , but only the 12th for women .
what about bonuses ?
there 's evidence that men receive bigger bonuses .
there is evidence that men receive a better client list than women , she says .
`` allocation of work '' is one think the 30 % club is encouraging companies to look at , she says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: homebase owner wesfarmers spins off supermarket arm
text: australia 's wesfarmers - owner of uk diy chain homebase - is spinning off its giant coles supermarket business , as well as its liquor and convenience store outlets .
wesfarmers said the move would allow it to grow its remaining businesses , including its australian diy chain bunnings - its best performing arm .
at the end of last year , coles accounted for approximately 60 % of wesfarmer 's capital base and about one third of its divisional earnings .
the west australian-based conglomerate bought an underperforming coles in 2007 for 22bn australian dollars ( £ 12.3bn ) .
since then [ we have ] successfully turned around the business and restored its position as a leading australian retailer , '' managing director rob scott said .
wesfarmer 's sydney-listed shares shot up more than 6 % on the news .

documents.title: shell to pull out of new zealand after 100 years
text: royal dutch shell is pulling out of new zealand after more than 100 years .
the firm is selling its oil and gas operations to austria 's omv - a company that 's chasing business in australasia - for $ 578m ( £ 415m ) .
the move comes as part of shell 's aim to divest some $ 30bn worth of assets by the end of this year .
vienna-based omv has been in new zealand since 1999 .

documents.title: city superstar bowing out ?
text: michael spencer is one of the best known names in the city of london .
he built up icap into one of the world 's biggest broking firms .
the company 's annual charity day , when celebrities would answer the phones , become an annual media event .
however , according to the newspapers today he is lining up the sale of his stake in nex to the us based cme group .
that stake would be worth up to £ 500m .

documents.title: does the uk have enough gas ?
text: two weeks ago uk gas prices hit their highest level in 12 years as the beast from the east blanketed the country in snow .
a further cold snap coming this weekend , but this time relations between the uk and russia , a key gas supplier , have badly deteriorated .
simon wood is an energy analyst at s & p global platts .
he thinks that it 's `` very unlikely '' that russia would turn off the gas supply to europe , as europe is its most important export market .
however , if russia did turn off the taps than europe would have to pay `` very elevated prices '' because it would then be competing for gas imports with asian nations .
the uk is hampered because it has `` significantly less '' storage than european counterparts .
in france utilities are required to have a portion of gas in store , he points out .
mr wood says the cold snap at the start of march means the uk has run down most of its stored gas supplies .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to friday 's business live page .
with more cold weather on the way , what is the situation with the uk 's supply of gas ?
one of the best known names in london 's financial district , michael spencer , might selling up .
and , staying with the city , how can financial services firms attract more women into top jobs ?
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
